com.steelypip.powerups.fusion

Class AbsFusionBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.steelypip.powerups.fusion.AbsFusionBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FusionBuilder
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FlexiFusionBuilder, JSONFusionBuilder

    public abstract class AbsFusionBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements FusionBuilder
    This implementation of MinXMLBuilder is maximally flexible:
    • It accepts null element names in startTagOpen, startTagClose and endTag.
    • The startTagClose method may be omitted in the build sequence.
    • After build is called, the builder can be reused.

      • startTag

        public void startTag(java.lang.String field,
                     java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.Boolean allow_repeats)
        Description copied from interface: FusionBuilder
        This method should be called to begin the construction of a start-tag with a particular element name. When the element is linked to the parent element, the field is used for the link. Name and field may be null, in which case they must be supplied as non-null later. If allow_repeats is specified, repeats are allowed. After this method, the next builder method should be add or endTag.
        Specified by:
        startTag in interface FusionBuilder
        Parameters:
        field - the field to be used for the link to the parent (or null)
        name - the name of the element to be constructed (or null).

      • bindName

        public void bindName(@Nullable java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from interface: FusionBuilder
        This method may be called at any time between startTag and endTag in order to provide the name the currently constructing element. If the value of name is null, this method has no effect.
        Specified by:
        bindName in interface FusionBuilder
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the element to be constructed (or null)

      • bindField

        public void bindField(@Nullable java.lang.String field)
        Description copied from interface: FusionBuilder
        This method may be called at any time between startTag and endTag in order to provide the field of the currently constructing element. If the value of field is null, this method has no effect. When the element is linked to the parent element, the field is used for the link.
        Specified by:
        bindField in interface FusionBuilder

      • bindAllowRepeats

        public void bindAllowRepeats(java.lang.Boolean allow_repeats)
        Description copied from interface: FusionBuilder
        This method may be called at any time between startTag and endTag in order to provide the allow_repeats. If it is specified, a repeated field is permitted. If the value is null the method has no effect.
        Specified by:
        bindAllowRepeats in interface FusionBuilder

      • endTag

        public void endTag(java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from interface: FusionBuilder
        This method finishes the construction of the current element. If the tag-name is non-null then it must be in agreement with the previous value. If the previous value is null then it is automatically in agreement.
        Specified by:
        endTag in interface FusionBuilder
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the element to be constructed (or null)

      • endTag

        public void endTag(java.lang.String field,
                   java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from interface: FusionBuilder
        This method finishes the construction of the current element and supplied field, name and allow_repeats. The field defines the how the element under construction will be linked it its parent. If the tag-name is non-null then it must be in agreement with the previous value. If the previous value is null then it is automatically in agreement.
        Specified by:
        endTag in interface FusionBuilder
        Parameters:
        field - the field name under which this element will be linked to its parent.
        name - the name of the element to be constructed (or null).

      • endTag

        public void endTag(java.lang.String field,
                   java.lang.String name,
                   java.lang.Boolean allow_repeats)
        Description copied from interface: FusionBuilder
        This method finishes the construction of the current element and supplied field, name and allow_repeats. The field defines the how the element under construction will be linked it its parent. The allow_repeats specifies if repeated entries to the same field is permitted. If the tag-name is non-null then it must be in agreement with the previous value. If the previous value is null then it is automatically in agreement.
        Specified by:
        endTag in interface FusionBuilder
        Parameters:
        field - the field name under which this element will be linked to its parent.
        name - the name of the element to be constructed (or null).
        allow_repeats - can are multiple entries for a single field allowed?

        Description copied from interface: FusionBuilder
